sense.name: utterly ruin
sense.examples: You shipwrecked my career with those two words. The bungled assassination attempt has shipwrecked him.

sense.name: fail or suffer failure
sense.examples: All who try to reach that star are shipwrecked. Two votes at 12:03am shipwrecked the bill. CAFTA ultimately passed two votes after many shipwrecked bills.

sense.name: destruction of a ship
sense.examples: I am an Englishman, madam, shipwrecked on this island. Captain David Dean O'Keefe was shipwrecked in Yap in the 1870s. In 1192, Richard left Palestine, but was shipwrecked on his way home. We got shipwrecked on that island and we tried to kill each other for food. Stephen Crane was shipwrecked off the coast of Florida in 1896. Cabeza de Vaca and his crew were said to be shipwrecked here in 1520.
